name: St Thomas Community Orchard
description: Located at Cowick Barton Playing Fields. Features heritage Devon apple varieties and pears.

name: Incredible Edible Exeter (St Sidwell’s)
description: Planters at St Sidwell’s Community Centre with free herbs, salads, and seasonal vegetables.

name: Exwick Hams Foraging
description: Floodplain meadows along the River Exe. Abundant wild garlic (spring), elderberries, and blackberries.

name: Ludwell Valley Park Orchard
description: A working 'cherry orchard' and traditional apple trees managed for the public within a large country park.

name: University of Exeter (Streatham Campus)
description: Award-winning botanical grounds. Features edible hedging, walnuts, and chestnuts across the estate.

name: Belmont Park Edible Border
description: Community-led edible planting featuring herbs and soft fruits along the park boundaries.

name: Exeter Quay & Canal Banks
description: Towpath stretches offering sloes, elderberries, and blackberries leading towards Double Locks.

name: Mincinglake Valley Park
description: Former landfill turned lush valley. Abundant hazelnuts, blackberries, and rosehips.

name: Incredible Edible Exeter (Heavitree)
description: Raised beds near Heavitree Pleasure Ground with free culinary herbs and perennial veg.

name: Pinces Gardens Orchard
description: Historic nursery site featuring mature fruit trees and a wisteria walk.

name: Double Locks Canal Path
description: Rich canal-side hedgerows with heavy crops of blackberries and elderberries.

name: Barley Valley Park
description: Steep valley paths offering sloes, hawthorn berries, and hazelnuts.

name: Topsham Coastal Edges
description: Estuary paths offering sea beet, maritime wild radish, and elderberries.

name: Incredible Edible Exeter (Wonford)
description: Community planters at Wonford Community Centre featuring herbs and greens.

name: Haldon Forest Edges (Rural Fringe)
description: Public boundary paths offering wild bilberries (autumn) and hazelnuts.
